intro: Sinosenecio pyrolifolius, commonly known as the Pyrola-leaved Senecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, often resembling a cluster of tiny buttons. Its leaves are typically basal, with a distinctive pyrola-like shape, giving it its common name. Sinosenecio pyrolifolius is often found in rocky or forested areas, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
